page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In 1910 Arborfield was a small village with one main road running through it.At one end of the village stood Newlands farm,a pond and pond cottages the pond has been drained but the farm and cottages are still there. Several other roads met at this point making it an inportant junction,known as Arborfield Cross. At the cross was a public house called 'the bull'. On the corner of the school road lived Jim Taylor,the tailor, whoes daughters worked at Arborfield,Newlands and opossite was a builders yard owned by the Garrett brothers. The yard is no longer there. Further up the road was an old post office,a black smith and the other,older village pub called 'The Swan'.
